001package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
006
007/**
008 * An implementation of {@link RealEigenDecomposition}, which merely wraps an
009 * instance of {@link EigenDecomposition} as provided by the Apache Commons Math
010 * library. Note this works only for square matrices and symmetry and zero
011 * tolerances cannot be specified, default values are always used. The Jama
012 * version ({@link EigenDecompositionJama}) generally appears to be more
013 * flexible and robust.
014 * 
015 * @author WB
016 * @version 2022/11/24
017 * 
018 * @see EigenDecompositionJama
019 * @see Eigensolver2x2
020 */
021public class EigenDecompositionApache implements RealEigenDecomposition {
022        
023        // instance of org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition
024        private final EigenDecomposition decomp;        
025        
026        /**
027         * Constructor, calculates the eigen decomposition of the specified matrix,
028         * which must be square but does not need to be symmetric. 
029         * 
030         * @param M the matrix to decompose
031         */
032        public EigenDecompositionApache(RealMatrix M) {
033                this.decomp = new EigenDecomposition(M);
034        }
035
036        @Override
037        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
038                return decomp.hasComplexEigenvalues();
039        }
040
041        @Override
042        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
043                return decomp.getRealEigenvalue(k);
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
048                return decomp.getRealEigenvalues();
049        }
050
051        @Override
052        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
053                return decomp.getEigenvector(k);
054        }
055
056        @Override
057        public RealMatrix getV() {
058                return decomp.getV();
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * Returns the underlying Apache eigendecomposition instance, mainly
063         * for debugging.
064         * 
065         * @return the Apache eigendecomposition instance
066         */
067        public EigenDecomposition getInternalDecomposition() {
068                return decomp;
069        }
070
071}
